titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Perry Miller Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Julie Ann Ludwig and Christine Weideman

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:59

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, clippings and writings which document John Perry Miller's career as an economist and academic administrator. The majority of these materials relate to his tenure as dean of the Yale Graduate School during the period 1961-1969.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research, with the exception of sensitive information about an individual's tenure case in box 4. For this reason, it is restricted until January 1, 2040.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John Perry Miller Papers, Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in three series: I. Personal and Correspondence, 1933-1991. II. Clippings, 1938-1983.III. Writings, 1951-1992.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of materials relating to John Perry Miller's career as an economist and academic administrator, including correspondence, clippings, and writings. The bulk of the papers date from 1961 to 1969, during Miller's tenure as the dean of the Yale Graduate School. Although the writings comprise the smallest portion of the collection, they are the most interesting. They include a number of unpublished essays, or "personal statements" by Miller on various topics related to higher education, and to graduate education in particular.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John Perry Miller, economist and academic administrator, was born in Lynn, Massachusetts, on March 26, 1911. The son of Fred and Hilda Wagner Miller, he was educated at Harvard University, receiving his B.A. in 1932, M.A. in 1934, and Ph.D. in 1937. Dr. Miller joined the Yale faculty as visiting lecturer in economics after teaching briefly at Harvard and Princeton. He was appointed professor of economics in 1950, and served as the director of Social Sciences, one of three major faculty divisions, from 1959 to 1961. Dr. Miller was named dean of the Graduate School in 1961 and held that post until his resignation in 1969.

Dean Miller's tenure saw a number of major changes in graduate education at Yale. He established the joint M.D.-Ph.D. program, as well as the Master of Philosophy degree, the latter of which was the first of its kind in the United States. Dr. Miller also instituted a combined degree program allowing students to receive a Bachelor's and Master's degree in the same course of study. In 1962, Dean Miller served on the faculty committee that recommended admitting women as undergraduates.

Following his resignation as dean of the Graduate School, Dr. Miller was named Director of Yale's Institution for Social and Policy Studies, where he played a major role in the planning and negotiations leading to the establishment of the Yale School of Organization and Management. He resigned his directorship in 1974. During this time, he also led the Campaign for Yale, a capital fund-raising drive aimed at collecting $370 million for the university, as its chief executive officer from 1973 to 1977. Dr. Miller served as deputy provost from 1977 to 1978, then briefly resumed teaching economics before his retirement in 1981.
Dean Miller married Dorothy Marie Willard in 1942, and they had two children, Perry and Ann. He died on February 9, 1997, in Hamden, Connecticut.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Personal and correspondence files consist mostly of John Perry Miller's correspondence with fellow Yale faculty members. There is one folder at the beginning of the series of biographical materials, including Miller's curriculum vitae and his own biographical sketches. The remainder of the series comprises correspondence which is arranged in two sections: topical and individuals. The topical section is arranged alphabetically; the individuals section is arranged alphabetically by last name of correspondent.

did.unittitle: Yale Graduate School Association Organizing Committee

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Clippings consist of newspaper and magazine clippings as well as press releases, and are arranged alphabetically by topic. Many are from Yale publications.

did.unittitle: "The Challenge of Graduate Education" [panel discussion with John Perry Miller, George W. Pierson, G. Evelyn Hutchinson, and Kingman Brewster], Yale Alumni Magazine
"Economics at Yale" [a series of three articles in the] Yale Daily News
Education and city development [symposium on New Haven]
Harvard Graduate Society for Advanced Study and Research
Institute for Social and Policy Studies
Institute of Social Science (ISS) and Institution of Social and Policy Studies (ISPS) funding
Tenure issues [includes clippings on the Dahl report]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Writings are arranged alphabetically by title, and include both published and unpublished essays, as well as speeches given by Miller.

did.unittitle: "The Continuity of the Educational Process: Advanced Placement in the Graduate School"
"The Economist Speaks" and "The Patron Saint of Economics at Yale..." [both concerning William F. Buckley's] God and Man at Yale
Graduate School Alumni Fund [open letter to "Alumni and Alumnae of the Graduate School"]
"The Graduate School and the University Community," Yale Alumni Magazine
"Notes on the Graduate School" [memorandum for A. Whitney Griswold]
Presidential address at the annual meeting of the Association of Graduate Schools (in the Association of American Universities), San Francisco
"Proposals for the Reorganization of the Graduate School" [draft]
"The Social Science Center: Yale and New Haven"
"Statement to the Joint Boards of Permanent Officers of Yale College and the Graduate School"
"To the Committee for Information on the Institute for Social Science"
"The University as the Sum of Many Parts"
"Yale 1991" [edited copy of a speech delivered at the Senior Class Dinner of Morse College, May 1969]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This file contains sensitive information about an individual's tenure case. For this reason, it is restricted until January 1, 2040.
